column5: Going to Minaki Ontario at the end of August/Early September, we will be staying at Barber's Resort and will be fishing muskies, walleyes and smallmouths. I expect we'll have a great trip, anyone care to share their experience fishing this area or staying at Barbers? I'm also trying to convince my friend Tim to go with us, if you can give any feedback that would help me get Tim on board I'd sure appreciate it. John

I've been to Minaki several times as a youngster. Never stayed at Barbers, but have stayed at Paradise Cove I and II many of times. Duane **** did a nice job with accommodations. We would fish walleyes in Big Sand all day! Great memories. Have fun!
Tell Tim the ice is almost sure to be out by then. You may even hit the post spawn just right!
That is one of the best times for solitude. Very few cottagers and tourists. The fishing should be amazing.As well that time of year ...NO BUGS
Here is my input (been up there since 1979), you have a good chance at catching a really nice Muskie on that system, there are some PIGS and they are usually hungry that time of year.
